long_desc.thetext:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

sr9800: Add check for usbnet_get_endpoints

The Linux kernel CVE team has assigned CVE-2024-26651 to this issue.

Upstream advisory:
https://lore.kernel.org/linux-cve-announce/2024032721-CVE-2024-26651-34b3@gregkh/T

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2271874]

The result of automatic check (that is developed by Alexander Larkin) for this CVE-2024-26651 is: 	SKIP	No affected files built, so skip this CVE	NO			-	-	unknown (where first YES/NO value means if related sources built).

bugs.title: CVE-2024-26651 kernel: sr9800: Add check for usbnet_get_endpoints [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-26651 kernel: sr9800: Add check for usbnet_get_endpoints [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-26651 kernel: sr9800: Add check for usbnet_get_endpoints

long_desc.thetext:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

sr9800: Add check for usbnet_get_endpoints

The Linux kernel CVE team has assigned CVE-2024-26651 to this issue.

Upstream advisory:
https://lore.kernel.org/linux-cve-announce/2024032721-CVE-2024-26651-34b3@gregkh/T

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2271874]

The result of automatic check (that is developed by Alexander Larkin) for this CVE-2024-26651 is: 	SKIP	No affected files built, so skip this CVE	NO			-	-	unknown (where first YES/NO value means if related sources built).

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2271873

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2271873,2271874

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

FEDORA-2024-e95585dfb9 (kernel-6.7.11-100.fc38) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 38.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-e95585dfb9

FEDORA-2024-2fcce4ffb7 (kernel-6.7.11-200.fc39) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 39.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-2fcce4ffb7

FEDORA-2024-e95585dfb9 has been pushed to the Fedora 38 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-e95585dfb9`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-e95585dfb9

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2024-2fcce4ffb7 has been pushed to the Fedora 39 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-2fcce4ffb7`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-2fcce4ffb7

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2024-2fcce4ffb7 (kernel-6.7.11-200.fc39) has been pushed to the Fedora 39 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-2024-e95585dfb9 (kernel-6.7.11-100.fc38) has been pushed to the Fedora 38 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
